intro: Delphinium nutans, commonly known as the nodding larkspur, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is characterized by its tall, spindly stems that bear clusters of striking blue to purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Delphinium nutans thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, known for its showy, often toxic flowers.
